ANSWER: Based on the diagnosis of cleidocranial dysplasia, I recommend a comprehensive treatment approach that combines evidence-based medical management with patient-centered care strategies. Initial management focuses on providing education about the condition and facilitating access to counseling and peer support. Long-term, regular follow-up is essential to monitor psychosocial health and any emerging physical or dental issues, while avoiding unnecessary interventions. This approach aims to enhance the patient’s quality of life, promote social integration, and support his mental health, while minimizing risks associated with unnecessary procedures.

- Long-term objectives (3-6 months): Achieve stable psychosocial adjustment; address any dental or skeletal concerns proactively; monitor mental health status periodically.
